Glossary:
Accelerated Procedure Justification Type A procurement procedure where the time limit for receipt of tenders can be reduced due to a state of urgency.
PIN_REDUCE_TIME_LIMIT Prior Information Notice to reduce time limits
STATE_OF_URGENCY State of Urgency
accessibility
included Accessibility criteria for persons with disabilities are included.
not-inc-proc Accessibility criteria for persons with disabilities are not included because the procurement is not intended for use by natural persons.
not-inc-just Accessibility criteria for persons with disabilities are not included with the following justification.

Confidentiality Level Type
PUBLIC Information that can be disclose without any particular restriction.
TOP_SECRET Information and material the unauthorised disclosure of which could cause exceptionally grave prejudice to the essential interests of the European Union, of one or more of the Member States or of one or more parties participating in a Procedure.
SECRET Information and material the unauthorised disclosure of which could seriously harm the essential interests of the European Union, of one or more of the Member States or of one or more parties participating in a Procedure.
CONFIDENTIAL Information and material the unauthorised disclosure of which could harm the essential interests of the European Union, of one or more of the Member States or of one or more parties participating in a Procedure.
RESTRICTED Information and material the unauthorised disclosure of which could be disadvantageous to the interests of the European Union, of one or more of the Member States or of one or more parties participating in a Procedure.

CPV The CPV establishes a single classification system for public procurement aimed at standardising the references used by procuring entities to describe the purpose of procurement contracts and procurement projects.
Compulsory use of Common Procurement Vocabulary (CPV) codes (Regulation (EC) No 213/2008)
03000000-1 Agricultural, farming, fishing, forestry and related products
03100000-2 Agricultural and horticultural products
03110000-5 Crops, products of market gardening and horticulture
03111000-2 Seeds
03111100-3 Soya beans
...
Criterion Group Property Type A code categorising the data structure category, how to use or process it, etc.
ON* Process the group always
ONTRUE Process the group if the previous question was and INDICATOR answered with the value 'true'
ONFALSE Process the group if the previous question was and INDICATOR answered with the value 'false'
currency The Currencies Named Authority List (NAL) or Common Authority Table (CAT) is a controlled vocabulary listing currencies with their authority code and labels in the 24 official languages of the EU (when available). The list is based on the ISO standard ISO 4217. This NAL is maintained by the Publications Office of the EU in its Metadata Registry (MDR).
Design Contest Type
OPEN
RESTRICTED
direct-award-justification Justifications for the choice of the negotiated procedure without prior publication of a call for competition or concession.
c-dir2009/81/EC The contract falls within the services listed in Annex II of the Directive 2009/81/EC
no-suit-resp No suitable tenders, requests to participate, or applications were received in response to a previous notice.
no-reg-resp No regular tenders, requests to participate, or applications acceptable under national provisions were received in response to a previous notice. Only those tenderers were included in the negotiations which have satisfied the selection criteria in the previous procedure.
res-exp-stu-dev Purpose of the contract is purely research, experiment, study or development under the conditions stated in the Directive
other-serv-dir2009/81/EC The contract concerns research and development services other than those referred to in Directive 2009/81/EC Art. 13
abs-comp The contract can be provided only by a particular economic operator because of an absence of competition for technical reasons
uniq-art-work The contract can be provided only by a particular economic operator because of creation or acquisition of a unique work of art or artistic performance
exc-rights The contract can be provided only by a particular economic operator because of exclusive rights, including intellectual property rights
other-righ-dir2014/23/EU The contract can be provided only by a particular economic operator because of protection of other exclusive rights, including intellectual property rights, other than those defined in Directive 2014/23/EU Art. 5(10)
inc-urg-res The periods for the restricted procedure and the negotiated procedure with prior publication of a contract notice are incompatible with the urgency resulting from a crisis
ext-urg Extreme urgency brought about by events unforeseeable for the buyer
rep-ext-dir Partial replacement or extension of existing supplies or installations by the original supplier ordered under the strict conditions stated in the Directive
rep-work-dir New works or services, constituting a repetition of existing works or services and ordered in accordance with the strict conditions stated in the Directive
des-con-awa Service contract to be awarded to the winner or one of winners under the rules of a design contest
supp-comm-mark Procurement of supplies quoted and purchased on a commodity market
pur-ope-wind Purchase on particularly advantageous terms from an economic operator which is definitely winding up its business activities
pur-liq-insol Purchase on particularly advantageous terms from the liquidator in an insolvency procedure, an arrangement with creditors or a similar procedure under national laws and regulations
temp-adv Bargain purchase taking advantage of a particularly advantageous opportunity available for a very short time at a price considerably lower than market prices
cont-arm-dir Contract related to the provision of air and maritime transport services for the armed forces of a Member State deployed or to be deployed abroad, under the strict conditions stated in the Directive
out-dir The procurement falls outside the scope of application of the directive
dps-usage
dps-list Dynamic purchasing system, only usable by buyers listed in this notice
dps-nlist Dynamic purchasing system, also usable by buyers not listed in this notice
none None
DPS scope
Buyers only listed in this notice
Buyers listed and not listed in this notice

fa-mix Framework agreement, partly without reopening and partly with reopening of competition

all-reject All tenders, requests to participate or porjects were rejected
buyer-ins-fund Decision of the buyer, because of insufficient funds
buyer-change Decision of the buyer, because of a change in needs

subc-change The contractor must indicate any change of subcontractors during the execution of the contract.
subc-award The buyer may oblige the contractor to award all or certain subcontracts through the procedure set out in Title III of Directive 2009/81/EC.
subc-award-dir2009/81/EC The contractor must subcontract a minimum percentage of the contract using the procedure set out in Title III of Directive 2009/81/EC.
